oneOf.description: Parameters for an input stream from RTP source. At least one of `video` and `audio` has to be defined.

input_id.description: An identifier for the input stream.

port.description: UDP port or port range on which the compositor should listen for the stream.

video.description: Parameters of a video source included in the RTP stream.

audio.description: Parameters of an audio source included in the RTP stream.

required.description: (**default=`false`**) If input is required and the stream is not delivered on time, then LiveCompositor will delay producing output frames.

offset_ms.description: Offset in milliseconds relative to the pipeline start (start request). If the offset is not defined then the stream will be synchronized based on the delivery time of the initial frames.

oneOf.description: Input stream from MP4 file. Exactly one of `url` and `path` has to be defined.

input_id.description: An identifier for the input stream.

required.description: (**default=`false`**) If input is required and frames are not processed on time, then LiveCompositor will delay producing output frames.

offset_ms.description: Offset in milliseconds relative to the pipeline start (start request). If offset is not defined then stream is synchronized based on the first frames delivery time.

shader_id.description: Id of a shader. It can be used in a [`Shader`](../components/Shader) component after registration.

instance_id.description: Id of a web renderer instance. It can be used in a [`WebView`](../components/WebView) component after registration.

url.description: Url of a website that you want to render.

embedding_method.description: Mechanism used to render input frames on the website.

oneOf.description: UDP protocol.
TCP protocol where LiveCompositor is the server side of the connection.

rtp_payload_type.description:
(**default=`96`**) Value of payload type field in received RTP packets.

Packets with different payload type won't be treated as video and included in composing. Values should be in [0, 64] or [96, 255]. Values in range [65, 95] can't be used. For more information, see [RFC](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5761#section-4) Packets with different payload type won't be treated as video and included in composing.

oneOf.description: H264 video.

sample_rate.description: Sample rate. If the specified sample rate doesn't match real sample rate, audio won't be mixed properly.

rtp_payload_type.description:
(**default=`97`**) Value of payload type field in received RTP packets.

Packets with different payload type won't be treated as audio and included in mixing. Values should be in range [0, 64] or [96, 255]. Values in range [65, 95] can't be used. For more information, check out [RFC](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5761#section-4).

forward_error_correction.description: (**default=`false`**) Specifies whether the stream uses forward error correction. It's specific for Opus codec. For more information, check out [RFC](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6716#section-2.1.7).

oneOf.description: Opus audio.
Mono audio (single channel).
Stereo audio (two channels).

input_id.description: Id of an input. It identifies a stream registered using a [`RegisterInputStream`](../routes#register-input-stream) request.

width.description: Width of a component in pixels. Required when using absolute positioning.

height.description: Height of a component in pixels. Required when using absolute positioning.

direction.description: Direction defines how static children are positioned inside a View component.

top.description: Distance in pixels between this component's top edge and its parent's top edge. If this field is defined, then the component will ignore a layout defined by its parent.

left.description: Distance in pixels between this component's left edge and its parent's left edge. If this field is defined, this element will be absolutely positioned, instead of being laid out by its parent.

bottom.description: Distance in pixels between the bottom edge of this component and the bottom edge of its parent. If this field is defined, this element will be absolutely positioned, instead of being laid out by its parent.

right.description: Distance in pixels between this component's right edge and its parent's right edge. If this field is defined, this element will be absolutely positioned, instead of being laid out by its parent.

rotation.description: Rotation of a component in degrees. If this field is defined, this element will be absolutely positioned, instead of being laid out by its parent.

transition.description: Defines how this component will behave during a scene update. This will only have an effect if the previous scene already contained a View component with the same id.

overflow.description: (**default=`"hidden"`**) Controls what happens to content that is too big to fit into an area.

oneOf.description: WebView component renders a website using Chromium.

instance_id.description:
Id of a web renderer instance. It identifies an instance registered using a [`RegisterRenderer`](../routes#register-renderer) request.

:::warning You can only refer to specific instances in one Component at a time. :::

shader_id.description: Id of a shader. It identifies a shader registered using a [`RegisterRenderer`](../routes#register-renderer) request.

shader_param.description:
Object that will be serialized into a `struct` and passed inside the shader as:

```wgsl @group(1) @binding(0) var ``` :::note This object's structure must match the structure defined in a shader source code. :::

resolution.description: Resolution of a texture where shader will be executed.

image_id.description: Id of an image. It identifies an image registered using a [`RegisterRenderer`](../routes#register-renderer) request.

width.description: Width of a texture that text will be rendered on. If not provided, the resulting texture will be sized based on the defined text but limited to `max_width` value.

height.description:
Height of a texture that text will be rendered on. If not provided, the resulting texture will be sized based on the defined text but limited to `max_height` value.

It's an error to provide `height` if `width` is not defined.

max_width.description: (**default=`7682`**) Maximal `width`. Limits the width of the texture that the text will be rendered on. Value is ignored if `width` is defined.

max_height.description: (**default=`4320`**) Maximal `height`. Limits the height of the texture that the text will be rendered on. Value is ignored if height is defined.

line_height.description: Distance between lines in pixels. Defaults to the value of the `font_size` property.

font_family.description: (**default=`"Verdana"`**) Font family. Provide [family-name](https://www.w3.org/TR/2018/REC-css-fonts-3-20180920/#family-name-value) for a specific font. "generic-family" values like e.g. "sans-serif" will not work.

style.description: (**default=`"normal"`**) Font style. The selected font needs to support the specified style.

weight.description: (**default=`"normal"`**) Font weight. The selected font needs to support the specified weight.

width.description: Width of a component in pixels.

height.description: Height of a component in pixels.

tile_aspect_ratio.description: (**default=`"16:9"`**) Aspect ratio of a tile in `"W:H"` format, where W and H are integers.

margin.description: (**default=`0`**) Margin of each tile in pixels.

padding.description: (**default=`0`**) Padding on each tile in pixels.

transition.description: Defines how this component will behave during a scene update. This will only have an effect if the previous scene already contained a `Tiles` component with the same id.

width.description: Width of a component in pixels. Required when using absolute positioning.

height.description: Height of a component in pixels. Required when using absolute positioning.

top.description: Distance in pixels between this component's top edge and its parent's top edge. If this field is defined, then the component will ignore a layout defined by its parent.

left.description: Distance in pixels between this component's left edge and its parent's left edge. If this field is defined, this element will be absolutely positioned, instead of being laid out by its parent.

bottom.description: Distance in pixels between this component's bottom edge and its parent's bottom edge. If this field is defined, this element will be absolutely positioned, instead of being laid out by its parent.

right.description: Distance in pixels between this component's right edge and its parent's right edge. If this field is defined, this element will be absolutely positioned, instead of being laid out by its parent.

rotation.description: Rotation of a component in degrees. If this field is defined, this element will be absolutely positioned, instead of being laid out by its parent.

transition.description: Defines how this component will behave during a scene update. This will only have an effect if the previous scene already contained a View component with the same id.

oneOf.description: Children positioned from left to right.
Children positioned from top to bottom.

duration_ms.description: Duration of a transition in milliseconds.

oneOf.description: Render everything, including content that extends beyond their parent.
Render only parts of the children that are inside their parent area.

If children components are too big to fit inside the parent, resize everything inside to fit. Components that have unknown sizes will be treated as if they had a size 0 when calculating scaling factor.

:::warning This will resize everything inside, even absolutely positioned elements. For example, if you have an element in the bottom right corner and the content will be rescaled by a factor 0.5x, then that component will end up in the middle of its parent :::
Disable text wrapping. Text that does not fit inside the texture will be cut off.
Wraps at a glyph level.
Wraps at a word level. Prevent splitting words when wrapping.
Weight 100.
Weight 200.
Weight 300.
Weight 400.
Weight 500.
Weight 600.
Weight 700.
Weight 800.
Weight 900.
Resize the component proportionally, so one of the dimensions is the same as its parent, but it still fits inside it.

Resize the component proportionally, so one of the dimensions is the same as its parent and the entire area of the parent is covered. Parts of a child that do not fit inside the parent are not rendered.

forward_error_correction.description: (**default=`false`**) Specifies whether the stream use forward error correction. It's specific for Opus codec. For more information, check out [RFC](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6716#section-2.1.7).

oneOf.description:
Pass raw input frames as JS buffers so they can be rendered, for example, using a `` component.

:::warning This method might have a significant performance impact, especially for a large number of inputs. :::
Render a website without any inputs and overlay them over the website content.
Render a website without any inputs and overlay them under the website content.
